sentence.text: Deregulation of the phosphoinositide 3-kinase (phosphorylation) pathway contributes to the development and progression of tumors.

Here, we determine that somatic mutations in phosphorylation (44%), phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase signaling (17%), positive regulation of blood vessel endothelial cell migration (15%), and negative regulation of protein phosphorylation (12%) are prevalent and diverse in Chinese breast cancer patients, with 60 novel mutations identified.

entity.text: positive regulation of blood vessel endothelial cell migration

sentence.text: A high proportion of tumors harbors multiple mutations, especially phosphorylation plus phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase signaling mutations (9.0%).
Collectively, these findings advance our understanding of phosphorylation impactful mutations in breast cancer and have important implications for PI3K-targeted therapy in precision oncology
